summary: The module provides a stochastic finite element example workflow, offering tools to create random material fields using Karhunen–Loève expansions, compute eigenvalues, evaluate trigonometric basis functions, and execute Monte‑Carlo simulations (both serial and threaded) to solve a simple structural mechanics problem and visualize the probabilistic results.
business_intent: Assist engineers and researchers in performing uncertainty quantification and reliability analysis of structural systems by modeling material variability and evaluating its impact on performance through probabilistic simulations.
